adverb.description: To one side; out of the way.
examples: they stood aside to let a car pass
she must put aside all her antagonistic feelings

noun.description: A remark or passage in a play that is intended to be heard by the audience but unheard by the other characters in the play.
examples: Shakespeare's use of asides and soliloquies

phrases: His jovial manner and friendly approach sets him aside from all others that ever worked in town.
It's a an exciting pageant of anniversaries this week, even aside from my own birthday.
In fact, aside from the occasional pan of seafood, Jonathan is virtually vegetarian.
I have been through emotional agony in almost every relationship with men, aside from my father and Robert.
A full scale search was launched and thankfully she was found unharmed, aside from suffering from the cold.
origin: Middle English (originally on side): see a, side.
